questions.question: What's the difference between global roles and course roles?
answer: Global roles are set in your user profile and apply platform-wide
Course roles are specific to each course you're enrolled in
Course roles override global roles within that course
Example: You can be a global Instructor but enrolled as a Student in someone else's course

answer: Check your dashboard - your role appears under each course

I can't see other students' projects. Is this a bug?
questions.answer: No, this is by design. Regular students can only see their own work to maintain privacy. If you need to help other students, ask your instructor about becoming a Student Assistant.

questions.question: How do I become a Student Assistant?
answer: Excel in your coursework
Show willingness to help classmates
Ask your instructor about the role
The instructor can promote you through the Students page

questions.question: What extra features do I get as a Student Assistant?
answer: View other students' projects (read-only)
See the course member list
Access peer work to provide help
Keep all your regular student permissions

questions.question: Can I edit other students' work as a Student Assistant?
questions.answer: No, Student Assistants have read-only access to peer work. This maintains academic integrity while allowing you to help.

questions.question: How do I add a co-instructor?
answer: Make sure they're enrolled in your course
Go to Students page
Find them in the list
Click Edit → Select "Instructor" → Confirm

questions.question: Can I remove another instructor?
questions.answer: No, instructors cannot remove each other. Only Global Admins can remove instructors for security reasons.

questions.question: How many Teaching Assistants can I have?
questions.answer: There's no limit. Assign as many as needed for your course size and structure.

questions.question: Can I edit courses as a School Administrator?
questions.answer: No, School Administrators have oversight permissions only. You can view but not modify courses to maintain instructor autonomy.

questions.answer: No, enrollment management remains with course instructors. School Admins monitor but don't directly manage courses.

questions.question: I got an email about a role change I didn't request
questions.answer: Contact your instructor immediately. All role changes are logged and can be investigated.

questions.question: Can Student Assistants see my private reflections?
questions.answer: No, only Teaching Assistants and above can view reflections.

questions.question: Is my data safe with peer assistants?
questions.answer: Yes, Student Assistants have read-only access and all access is logged.

questions.question: Can someone access my work after I leave a course?
questions.answer: When you're removed from a course, all course-specific access is revoked immediately.
